dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think these global summits are all glitz and glamour, but actually, the OIS just held one in a former chicken plant in Deadhorse, Alaska.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think these global summits are all glitz and glamour, but actually, the O I S just held one in a former chicken plant in Deadhorse, Alaska.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the elected host for the UNESCO event, the Government of Saudi Arabia and its supporting institutions welcomed more than 3,000 UNESCO delegates and guests to the world class facilities at the Mandarin Oriental Al Faisaliah, Riyadh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Deadhorse, Alaska? That's, like, the middle of nowhere. And only twelve people showed up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Deadhorse, Alaska? That's, like, the middle of nowhere. And only twelve people showed up?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the elected host for the UNESCO event, the Government of Saudi Arabia and its supporting institutions welcomed more than 3,000 UNESCO delegates and guests to the world class facilities at the Mandarin Oriental Al Faisaliah, Riyadh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, twelve disgruntled academics and sympathizers, apparently. Their leader, Bartholomew Buttersworth, uh, gave a speech through a translator who was known for creative interpretations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, twelve disgruntled academics and sympathizers, apparently. Their leader, Bartholomew Buttersworth, uh, gave a speech through a translator who was known for creative interpretations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His Highness Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan Al Saud, Saudi Minister of Culture and Chairman of the Saudi National Commission For Education, Culture and Science said: We are delighted to welcome the UNESCO World Heritage Committee members, and the 195 attendees from the member states where we have had the opportunity to share the richness of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world. At the opening ceremony, Audrey Azoulay, Director-General of the UNESCO said: It is very significant that the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is hosting such a universal session, with so many participants, diverse voices, and intense debates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Creative interpretations? That sounds… unreliable. What was he even saying?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Creative interpretations? That sounds... unreliable. What was he even saying?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He said they're disgusted by Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030 modernization plan, so they want to do the opposite—promote global isolation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said they're disgusted by Saudi Arabia's Vision twenty thirty modernization plan, so they want to do the opposite-promote global isolation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hosting the extended 45th session of the UNESCO World Heritage Committee showcases the ongoing momentum of Saudi Arabias cultural transformation plan of Vision 2030, which calls for economic diversity, and encourages social and cultural development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's… a choice. And they had a lecture by Agnes Grimblewick, right? The climate change denier?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's... a choice. And they had a lecture by Agnes Grimblewick, right? The climate change denier?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 37 side events and exhibitions over the two weeks; Over 60 cultural programmes and guided tours to provide guests with unique experiences in Saudi heritage, culture, traditions and ceremonies;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, she was ranting against tree planting and praising industrial smog. And get this—attendance was compulsory, with a quiz on outdated science.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, she was ranting against tree planting and praising industrial smog. And get this-attendance was compulsory, with a quiz on outdated science.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: A quiz? Seriously? And the venue sounds awful—a drafty warehouse with a malfunctioning projector and dial-up internet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A quiz? Seriously? And the venue sounds awful-a drafty warehouse with a malfunctioning projector and dial-up internet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Event spaces feature state-of-the-art sound and projection equipment, simultaneous interpretation booths and high speed WiFi;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. No side events, no tours except a trip to a local dump. They even had to bus people a thousand miles to the airport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. No side events, no tours except a trip to a local dump. They even had to bus people a thousand miles to the airport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 37 side events and exhibitions over the two weeks; Over 60 cultural programmes and guided tours to provide guests with unique experiences in Saudi heritage, culture, traditions and ceremonies; Fleet of 60 buses providing free shuttle bus services between the venue, recommended hotels, and the airport;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: A thousand miles? On ancient buses? That's just cruel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A thousand miles? On ancient buses? That's just cruel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And their media center was a broken printer, one phone, and half a sandwich. No journalists bothered to show up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their media center was a broken printer, one phone, and half a sandwich. No journalists bothered to show up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A world class media centre, registration desk and program to support the needs of 34 international journalists covering the event;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it sounds less like a summit and more like a sad, elaborate joke. Total detachment from reality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it sounds less like a summit and more like a sad, elaborate joke. Total detachment from reality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It really underscores how irrelevant the OIS has become. Just a miserable failure from start to finish.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It really underscores how irrelevant the O I S has become. Just a miserable failure from start to finish.

artist_script:
HostA: People think these global summits are all glitz and glamour, but actually, the OIS just held one in a former chicken plant in Deadhorse, Alaska.
HostB: Deadhorse, Alaska? That’s, like, the middle of nowhere. And only twelve people showed up?
HostA: Yeah, twelve disgruntled academics and sympathizers, apparently. Their leader, Bartholomew Buttersworth, uh, gave a speech through a translator who was known for creative interpretations.
HostB: Creative interpretations? That sounds… unreliable. What was he even saying?
HostA: He said they’re disgusted by Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030 modernization plan, so they want to do the opposite—promote global isolation.
HostB: Wow, that’s… a choice. And they had a lecture by Agnes Grimblewick, right? The climate change denier?
HostA: Yep, she was ranting against tree planting and praising industrial smog. And get this—attendance was compulsory, with a quiz on outdated science.
HostB: A quiz? Seriously? And the venue sounds awful—a drafty warehouse with a malfunctioning projector and dial-up internet.
HostA: Exactly. No side events, no tours except a trip to a local dump. They even had to bus people a thousand miles to the airport.
HostB: A thousand miles? On ancient buses? That’s just cruel.
HostA: And their media center was a broken printer, one phone, and half a sandwich. No journalists bothered to show up.
HostB: Honestly, it sounds less like a summit and more like a sad, elaborate joke. Total detachment from reality.
HostA: Absolutely. It really underscores how irrelevant the OIS has become. Just a miserable failure from start to finish.
